item.title: Michael add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "When my information changes, I alter my conclusions. What do you do, sir?" -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Michael add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "Everybody does have a book in them, but in most cases that's where it should stay." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Michael add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Michael add a quote by Harold Abelson
item.description: "Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute." -- Harold Abelson

item.title: Michael add a quote by John Stewart
item.description: "Oh billions of dollars — is there no dispute you can’t settle?" -- John Stewart

item.title: Michael add a quote by Theodore Sturgeon
item.description: "90% of everything is crap." -- Theodore Sturgeon

item.title: Michael add a quote by Alberto Savinio
item.description: "When applied to software, Sturgeon's Law is hopelessly optimistic." -- Alberto Savinio

item.title: Michael add a quote by Christopher Hitchens
item.description: "What can be asserted without proof can be dismissed without proof." -- Christopher Hitchens

item.title: Michael add a quote by Edsger Dijkstra
item.description: "It is practically impossible to teach good programming to students that have had a prior exposure to BASIC: as potential programmers they are mentally mutilated beyond hope of regeneration." -- Edsger Dijkstra

item.title: Michael add a quote by Philip Greenspun
item.description: "Any sufficiently complicated C or Fortran program contains an ad hoc, informally-specified, bug-ridden, slow implementation of half of Common Lisp." -- Philip Greenspun

item.title: Michael add a quote by Linus Pauling
item.description: "The way to get good ideas is to get lots of ideas, and throw the bad ones away." -- Linus Pauling

item.title: Michael add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "The best is the enemy of good." -- Voltaire

item.title: Michael add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "There is no such thing as bad whiskey. Some whiskeys just happen to be better than others. But a man shouldn’t fool with booze until he’s fifty; then he’s a damn fool if he doesn’t." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Michael add a quote by Arthur Schopenhauer
item.description: "The person who writes for fools is always sure of a large audience." -- Arthur Schopenhauer

item.title: Michael add a quote by Alan Kay
item.description: "The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language." -- Alan Kay

item.title: Michael add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child. For what is the worth of human life, unless it is woven into the life of our ancestors by the records of history?" -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Michael add a quote by Francis Bacon
item.description: "They are ill discoverers that think there is no land when they can see nothing but sea." -- Francis Bacon

item.title: Michael add a quote by John Maynard Keynes
item.description: "Words ought to be a little wild for they are the assault of thoughts on the unthinking." -- John Maynard Keynes

item.title: Michael add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "The smart way to keep people passive and obedient is to strictly limit the spectrum of acceptable opinion, but allow very lively debate within that spectrum...." -- Noam Chomsky
